commit_message:
Change /run bind mount for neutron/openvswitch

Currently we have a very wide /run mount for all Neutron/OVS services,
which allows sudo/rootwrap to contact with the hosts dbus - all symptoms
are documented in the related bug.

Since we use tcp connections to OVS from Neutron agents - removing
bind mounts.

Closes-Bug: #1861792

Change-Id: Ifee4bec7b2e9ef4e2d624b1411f1a9e6332325c6
(cherry picked from commit 227008cf68aa68f340d95703e85355ae81585506)

commit_message:
[Stein and older] Ensure tmpwatch installed

tmpwatch needs to be installed in the case of deployed server. In newer
versions this is handled by an ansible role.

Change-Id: I7fb132f808f29927ab4ac0bc401233bc0f596dc0
Closes-Bug: #1864118
(cherry picked from commit f13000be15fb686a6316f3f037d4e2e86bca468a)

commit_message:
Random cleanups

Remove some cruft from Sphinx config files, drop the use of 'u' prefixed
strings, which are unnecessary in Python 3, and generally tidy stuff up.

Change-Id: Ib0f33576e160ec842d7fc82b4fcfee99829623d7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-20 09:19:33.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Various Python 3 fixes

Now that we've dropped py2 support we shouldn't be stating that we
support universal (Python 2 and 3) wheels. We should also use the proper
setuptools machinery to prevent people accidentally installing
novalclient in a Python 2.7 environment.

An unused 'upload_sphinx' section is also removed.

Change-Id: Icee145f44a42c233008b3328f52a3eec933101e0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-02-21 09:57:34.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Various Python 3 fixes

Now that we've dropped Python 2 support, we shouldn't be stating that we
support universal (Python 2 and 3) wheels. We should also use the proper
setuptools machinery to prevent people accidentally installing
novaclient in a Python 2.7 environment. Resolve both issues, removing an
unused 'upload_sphinx' section in the process.

Change-Id: Icee145f44a42c233008b3328f52a3eec933101e0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Various Python 3 fixes

Now that we've dropped Python 2 support, we shouldn't be stating that we
support universal (Python 2 and 3) wheels. We should also use the proper
setuptools machinery to prevent people accidentally installing
novaclient in a Python 2.7 environment. Resolve both issues, removing an
unused 'upload_sphinx' section in the process.

Change-Id: Icee145f44a42c233008b3328f52a3eec933101e0
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
tox: Configure 'ignore_basepython_conflict'

Resolves the following warning:

  UserWarning: conflicting basepython version (set 37, should be 36) for
  env 'py36';resolve conflict or set ignore_basepython_conflict

and makes sure we're testing with what we should be.

Some random indentation is fixed while we're here.

Change-Id: I6f3e98cc33731f528a3a755300f1fcc65c6b53ff
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Updated from generate-constraints

hold back docutils because boto likes to cap things
hold back msgpack because salt likes to cap things
hold back alembic because it breaks nova tests
  - https://review.opendev.org/708707
hold back enum34 for https://bitbucket.org/stoneleaf/enum34/issues/27/enum34-118-broken
  - will need to be masked

Change-Id: Iadc4554ba3c2d38f629ac8c80a72851aecda38d6

commit_message:
Add ceph_ansible_repo variable on ceph-base

In order to properly evaluate the ceph-ansible
repo using validations, this change adds the
"ceph_ansible_repo" variable to point to the
correct default tripleo ceph repo.

Change-Id: Ib398bbb5765fbe87f8e37d7a58b356f7d4670c87
Related-Bug: 1857460
(cherry picked from commit 020ad398d5c921dbdd184a499f1214b1f15212f9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-21 09:57:34.000000000', 'message': 'trivial: Remove 'u' prefix from string

It looks like nova is using 'repr()' in some validation error logging.
On Python 2.7, this would result in unicode strings (which most web apps
use) being output as "u'foo'", while in Python 3 these would just be
"'foo'". Since nova only supports Python 3 now, we only have to support
the Python 3 string formatting variant in our tests too.

Change-Id: I546c06a3251e86f39e2e7db48e04ec382c8da854
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
trivial: Remove 'u' prefix from string

It looks like nova is using 'repr()' in some validation error logging.
On Python 2.7, this would result in unicode strings (which most web apps
use) being output as "u'foo'", while in Python 3 these would just be
"'foo'". Since nova only supports Python 3 now, we only have to support
the Python 3 string formatting variant in our tests too.

Change-Id: I546c06a3251e86f39e2e7db48e04ec382c8da854
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup docs building

* Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version and remove values that are
  set now by openstackdocstheme.
* Remove py2 requirments for docs, we only build with python3.
* Update deps for docs building, we don't need the default.
* Remove modindex, this is not build, see
  https://docs.openstack.org/ec2-api/latest/py-modindex.html

Change-Id: I6958cbed944de0a1eea02de10c5a4916b6a7293d

commit_message:
Fix house keeping graceful shutdown

SIGTERM was not caught by house keeping service, threads were not
correctly terminated and spare amphora creation may have been killed
when restarting the service, leaving amphorae in BOOTING status.

Story: 2007008
Task: 37788

Change-Id: Ib3d6aa0f2fd550c3a8756c41e0159c5ae8127c7c
(cherry picked from commit df0ba06c1e96dc5ad4855d24435970ee926175ca)

[{'created': '2020-02-06 13:27:42.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Use auto-detected python interpreter except on CentOS 7

This switches to python 3 as the remote python interpreter on
Debian/Ubuntu jobs, with CentOS 7 as the only exception using python 2.

Also switch to auto-detection of the interpeter except for CentOS 7,
which should be based on the one used by ansible-playbook (python 3).

Change-Id: Ie4aff6123dfc7267fe78f4bd736565fb72fe135e
Partially-Implements: python-3
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Use auto-detected python interpreter except on CentOS 7

This switches to python 3 as the remote python interpreter on
Debian/Ubuntu jobs, with CentOS 7 as the only exception using python 2.

Also switch to auto-detection of the interpeter except for CentOS 7,
which should be based on the one used by ansible-playbook (python 3).

Change-Id: Ie4aff6123dfc7267fe78f4bd736565fb72fe135e
Partially-Implements: python-3

[{'created': '2020-02-22 21:23:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705361/

We need to configure CNI plugin first, then configure and restart

commit_message:
Fix https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705361/

We need to configure CNI plugin first, then configure and restart
containerd. In before, the order is reverse so the CNI config
is not picked.

Change-Id: I1c0e753b19289c339e44f288cae02d7ee2957da6

commit_message:
Add delete_netdev field in VIFPortProfileOpenVSwitch profile

In case of Smart NIC, os-vif is used to unplug the representor port from
the integration bridge, but this causing an issue that it also try to
delete the net device, so providing a field delete_netdev in
VIFPortProfileOpenVSwitch profile to manage if we need to delete the
netdev or not.

Related-Bug: #1859976
Change-Id: I3098c1c878d44a239af7725391c3645619e462c1

commit_message:
remove external dependency from devstack

Cirros and OpenWRT images are downloaded and registered to Glance during
Tacker devstack installation. But it is better to avoid these external
dependencies so that we can complete the installation even if image
download links are broken.

Change-Id: I8bd9ef27267ae2097d9cdce5d655c77d9e4a3aad

If port update fails during unshelve of an offloaded server then
placement allocation on the target host is leaked.

Change-Id: I7be32e4fc2e69f805535e0a437931516f491e5cb
Related-Bug: #1862633
'}]
commit_message:
Reproduce bug 1862633

If port update fails during unshelve of an offloaded server then
placement allocation on the target host is leaked.

Change-Id: I7be32e4fc2e69f805535e0a437931516f491e5cb
Related-Bug: #1862633

commit_message:
WIP: Add policy limit to volume related actions

In volume.api or other action apis, there is a citizen authentication of
ctxt.authorize(), but the user (RULE_ADMIN_OR_OWNER or RULE_ADMIN_API)
limit is not added in the file corresponding to the policies, which is
confusing.

Change-Id: I07b8d3f731e8778ffae3ef9a47ec2119c07fae89

Hi melanie, thank you for your review, I'll change it."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-08-17 01:50:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-23 21:35:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

I definitely don't like the idea of doing this within the PUT /servers/{server_id} API. It would much more naturally fit in the os-volume_attachments API, but the PUT method on that resource is already being used for the swap volume operation. We could entertain the idea of changing swap volume to a server action, since that's really what it is, but it would be a much larger change. Alternatively, if we allowed simply specifying delete_on_termination in the volume attach API, if you needed to change that value, you could just detach and re-attach with the new value - I realize that's a bit heavy handed, but it's an alternative."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-10-23 23:09:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

> (5 comments)
 > 
 > I definitely don't like the idea of doing this within the PUT
 > /servers/{server_id} API. It would much more naturally fit in the
 > os-volume_attachments API, but the PUT method on that resource is
 > already being used for the swap volume operation. We could
 > entertain the idea of changing swap volume to a server action,
 > since that's really what it is, but it would be a much larger
 > change. Alternatively, if we allowed simply specifying
 > delete_on_termination in the volume attach API, if you needed to
 > change that value, you could just detach and re-attach with the new
 > value - I realize that's a bit heavy handed, but it's an
 > alternative.

Agreed that I don't think adding this to PUT /servers/<server> is appropriate.

And I don't see realistically changing the swap volume API to a server action, especially not solely for the ability to modify delete_on_termination. If we moved swap volume to a server action and re-purposed volume PUT for updating delete_on_termination, would we use it to allow other updates to block device mappings? I'm thinking about use cases where operators have changed storage backend credentials and need to update block device mapping connection_info (though I'm not sure they would find volume PUT friendly enough for that). If there is other usefulness in updating block device mappings, I could maybe see it being worth changing swap volume to a server action and re-purposing volume PUT.

I think the alternative mentioned here makes sense. Adding the ability to specify delete_on_termination would bring parity with the server create API. But agreed it would be a bit of a pain, having to detach/attach to change it."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-10-24 08:45:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(6 comments)

Thanks mriedem and melwitt.
I agree with Matt's suggestion, and I have not found a better API method than the PUT method in the nova API.
Or add an API method just to set the value of the delete_on_termination field of the data volume?
If I do this, I prefer to use the PUT method instead of adding a new method. I think this is easy to accept for API changes.

If the volume attach API supports delete_on_termination, there is also a need to add a new microversion, I think it is not appropriate to put in the current specs, I submitted another specs application, please see[1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/612949/"}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-10-24 08:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-24 12:32:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> If the volume attach API supports delete_on_termination, there is also a need to add a new microversion

You will need a new microversion either way. If the request body changes anywhere in the API, it requires a new microversion because we need to validate the schema (and for interoperability).'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-10-25 00:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I know this, I mean that the update_on_termination of the configuration data volume needs to use the update server API, the other specs are used for the volume attach API, and the delete_on_termination can be configured when the volume is attached for the instance.:P'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-10-25 00:53:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

This came up at the summit in Berlin, you can read the notes here:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/BER-bfv-improvements

To summarize, there are kind of mixed feelings on this, and there are two parts to the change:

1. Specifying delete_on_termination when attaching a volume - there was generally more agreement on this being OK since it would have parity with the server create block_device_mapping_v2 flag, but I would not say there was a lot of enthusiasm for adding this in general.

2. Being able to update the delete_on_termination flag on existing attachments got a less than favorable reception, mostly because of the complexity and implications it could have to things like Heat stacks. Also, there are several alternatives to the use case for this (and the use case of the user having to manually delete volumes later isn't that strong to begin with).

So just FYI but I don't think you'll probably get much support for the latter proposal. Maybe I shouldn't have asked you to combine the specs. :)"}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-11-29 01:40:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hi Matt, I read the information on the etherpad, which is consistent with what you summarized above. As mentioned before the merger, personally, I insisted on separating the two features to discuss, so I need to restore *that* patch[1], and roll back the current patch to PS5 (copy the contents of PS5 to PS8)? Just wasting some time.

In addition, after the merger of these two patches, it is a challenge for the reviewer, which is more confusing.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2018-11-29 02:18:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Overall, I'm hesitant about the idea of adding a different mode to the swap volume API that will not swap a volume but instead update block device mapping. The volumeAttachment request parameter isn't option, and it sounds like this proposal would need to make it optional _and_ add a block_device_mapping_v2 parameter at the same time. It sounds messy and confusing to me."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-04-10 10:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(4 comments)

Hi melwitt, thanks for your review.
Yes. this will use the volume attachment API (PUT), which looks at the current API that interacts with the volume. But this requires adding new parameters to its request body. Considering that an instance will have multiple volumes, block_device_mapping_v2 is used, which is an array that can record information about multiple volumes.

I hope to explain your confusion of this spec description :)'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-05-20 10:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Patch Set 12 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-05-23 12:30:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

Now I would change my mind if there was a use case that isn't fixed by using Ansible, Terraform or Heat to mange resource, like most users really should be. See my comments in PS23, I think you misunderstood what I was saying about volume_id in the path and volumeId in the body.

pep8 is failing because you removed the "Feature Liaison" section.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-10-31 02:04:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

(2 comments)

Thanks Matt.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-10-31 03:05:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-04 21:52:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

My feeling on this is we don't really need this and there are suitable alternatives available but I realize doing this is relatively easy since the plumbing is already there for the most part. So I'm a no-vote for now since I'm not really in favor of doing it but I'm not strongly opposed either. If there were more than one group of users/vendors asking for this then I'd be more persuaded to do this."}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-11-06 08:22:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Code-Review-1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-12-15 22:34:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26: Code-Review-1

Wait..., there is an issue I just found, the volume attachment API is admin only API, and as I remember it doesn't suppose to be used by non-admin user https://openstack.nimeyo.com/75343/openstack-cinder-volume-updating-attached-volume-function.

If it is admin user only API, then it doesn't match your usecase. And we shouldn't expose swap volume to non-admin user"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-12-16 02:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

Swap volume is and should remain admin only. Updating fields in a volume attachment without swapping it could be separated from swap volume via enforcement of the request body and a new policy rule. The question all along has been is the complexity worth it for this feature when we already have alternatives.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-12-16 03:19:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

> The question all along has been is the complexity worth it for this
 > feature when we already have alternatives.

IMO, it's complicated but practical.

When there are a lot of servers in the envirement (e.g. in Government Cloud env more than 1000+), of course there are also need some volumes, and these volume are specially named to retain important data, if we want to cleanup the environment, and free mem, cpu and other host resources, I think this change is better (it just a small usecase).

Emm ... In the customer environment, there are their own management methods, such as making an application, requesting approval, and retaining designated resources/data."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-12-31 01:16:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Patch Set 26 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2020-01-04 06:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28: Published edit on patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-01-09 14:22:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

I'll repeat my earlier concern that we are overloading the update volume API here and that it would be much cleaner if we could separate the admin only swap_volume flow from this before we proceed with this user driven usecase.

I appreciate I never followed up with this after the Denver PTG so I'm not going to -1 this but I just wanted to air my concern again."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-02-13 21:15:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

We're at spec freeze. I'm going to defer this if it hasn't been approved by EOB Friday Feb 14."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2020-02-14 15:48:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Patch Set 28 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-02-14 15:56:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Code-Review-1

i have one question regarding why we cant just do a put to the volume attachment api but i believe the answer is we already stole that for swap volume so now we are trying to use this for both.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-02-20 13:06:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

in the attach a volume to an instance API.

commit_message:
Support re-configure deleted_on_termination in server

This blueprint proposes to allow changing the ``deleted_on_termination``
attribute of a volume after an instance is booted.

APIImpact

Blueprint: destroy-instance-with-datavolume

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-21 07:37:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix: --poll inconsistency

When we use `--poll` parameter with cinder create command, it waits
for the volume to become available but doesn't update the data
displayed to the user.
Due to this, there are inconsistency between several parameters
in the output after 'poll' and 'cinder show' command.
Eg: cinder create 1 --image <image-id> --poll
shows 'bootable' flag as false
whereas, cinder show <vol-id>
shows 'bootable' as true

Change-Id: I1502e88f1cd84d225b75c07313e4eb252cc2d645
Closes-Bug: #1855224
(cherry picked from commit ceddb3cfd033661f63d1245a45e0e197561be19c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix: --poll inconsistency

When we use `--poll` parameter with cinder create command, it waits
for the volume to become available but doesn't update the data
displayed to the user.
Due to this, there are inconsistency between several parameters
in the output after 'poll' and 'cinder show' command.
Eg: cinder create 1 --image <image-id> --poll
shows 'bootable' flag as false
whereas, cinder show <vol-id>
shows 'bootable' as true

Change-Id: I1502e88f1cd84d225b75c07313e4eb252cc2d645
Closes-Bug: #1855224
(cherry picked from commit ceddb3cfd033661f63d1245a45e0e197561be19c)

subject: Support enabling CRI for containerd
messages:
[{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-02 18:24:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-02 19:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-02 19:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-02 19:29:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-08 17:36:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-08 21:15:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-09 00:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-09 19:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-10 03:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-10 03:48:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Patch is ready for review.

Basically, this patch adds an option to configure the containerd+cri plugin for docker installation. Since CRI requires CNI plugins, I add CNI installation as well.

To use this feature, first, users need to enable the CRI for containerd (disabled by default):

  ENABLE_CONTAINERD_CRI=True

Second, users can configure the CNI plugins. For example:

  CNI_PLUGINS_INSTALL_PLUGINS=loopback,bridge

Lastly, users can provide their own CNI config file in a directory:

  CNI_PLUGINS_CONF_SOURCE_DIR=$DEST/zun/etc/cni/net.d'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-10 03:50:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Zun will use this feature. I hope it will be useful for kuryr-kubernetes as well.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2020-02-13 16:18:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

We haven't been planning to support containerd, but sure, it might be pretty useful one day."}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2020-02-22 16:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Support enabling CRI for containerd

Installing docker will install the CRI plugin for containerd.
This commit support enabling the CRI-containerd plugin.
By default, this is disabled.

Change-Id: Ica8d5f91ae77d1d6599bfadc4031552016ad8953

commit_message:
Add port-range remote_group security group testcase

This patch adds tests for checking remote security groups
with port-ranges.


Change-Id: I8d70fd4ba1835280abd26d5ba0777a44d80e591b
Related-Bug: #1844116

Security group can have a state of empty ports but non-empty members. So
we need skip the flow update only when members dict is empty.

commit_message:
Check SG members instead of ports to skip flow update

Security group can have a state of empty ports but non-empty members. So
we need skip the flow update only when members dict is empty.

Change-Id: I429edb3d2dea5fa97441909b4d2c776f97f0516f
Closes-Bug: #1862703
Related-Bug: #1854131
(cherry picked from commit 6dbba8d5ce18805a6f104782510c055017267435)

commit_message:
Get rid of Python 2 support

2020 came, everyone should be using Python 3 now.

As per the official python support timeline set forth
by the OpenStack TC [1], OpenStack Train (in our case,
kolla 9.x) is the last release that will support python2.7.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html

Related bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1856678

Merging depends on TripleO team - once they move CI job to CentOS 8 we
can merge.

Implements: blueprint drop-py2-support

Change-Id: Ic459561ab6ab8c62993c044c7a82d887839da289

commit_message:
Docs: use extrefs to link to other projects' docs

This feature of openstackdocstheme means that we'll always link to the
corresponding branch of another project (i.e. latest links to latest,
but train links to train, &c.)

https://docs.openstack.org/openstackdocstheme/latest/#external-link-helper

Change-Id: If94115f87af3689413405f3283be7fb197fab058

Add Apache packages to glance containers

Will add ssl for glance api and change startup from python to apache for
glance api so add apache packages.

Change-Id: Id89c0e241cde9ba0118fc5f6ed7236ddd6853b60
Related: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network
Signed-off-by: yj.bai <bai.yongjun@99cloud.net>

commit_message:
Fix run for branched build-containers job

With https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708893/
branched container build jobs are not running,
this patch creates seperate parent with correct
branches setting so branched jobs runs in tripleo-ci.

Change-Id: I407133900657c70a7b2be8ef678c57d2e1ae90e9

This reverts commit 1e8d13d96db525b11b7e615628a421d1ebe4bb5b.

commit_message:
Centralize traffic when LB and member has FIP

When Load Balancer and its member has FIP assigned
and environment is configured to use DVR the member
FIP needs to be centralized. It is current core OVN
limitation, that should be solved in [1].

This patch adds this mechanism to OVN Client.
It covers cases:

1) FIP association on port that is a member of
   some LB - make it centralized.
2) FIP association on LB VIP - find a members
   FIPs and centralized them.
3) The reverse of each of the above cases.

Related-Bug: #1860662

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1793897

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py
    networking_ovn/common/constants.py
    networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.p

Change-Id: I254f0ac28f7585b699a8238e01ffb37dd70282ef
(cherry picked from commit 57ac38921efa6bbf0bc4a22950355256cc3ebe6d)

[{'created': '2020-02-04 14:54:42.000000000', 'message': "Support Incremental Backup Completion In RBD

Ceph RBD backend ignores the `--incremental` option when creating a
volume backup. The first backup of a given volume is always a full
backup, and each subsequent backup is always an incremental backup.
This behavior makes it impossible to remove old backups while
keeping at least one recent backup.

Since Cinder will not find the latest_backup id as parent_id if
'--incremental=False', so we can use the parent_id to ensure
whether do the full backup in rbd driver or not.

If the incremental flag '--incremental' is not specified, this
patch will always create a new full backup for rbd volume.

Closes-Bug: #1810270
Closes-Bug: #1790713

Co-Authored-By: Sofia Enriquez <lsofia.enriquez@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5018727f8e18992e64c55b84f0d5b39ae7c70b32)

	cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_ceph.py
Change-Id: I516b7c82b05b26e81195f7f106d43a9e0804082d
(cherry picked from commit 6cc8adb132b91be68c0b22c750417efb97f08ce0)
"}]
commit_message:
Support Incremental Backup Completion In RBD

Ceph RBD backend ignores the `--incremental` option when creating a
volume backup. The first backup of a given volume is always a full
backup, and each subsequent backup is always an incremental backup.
This behavior makes it impossible to remove old backups while
keeping at least one recent backup.

Since Cinder will not find the latest_backup id as parent_id if
'--incremental=False', so we can use the parent_id to ensure
whether do the full backup in rbd driver or not.

If the incremental flag '--incremental' is not specified, this
patch will always create a new full backup for rbd volume.

Closes-Bug: #1810270
Closes-Bug: #1790713
Co-Authored-By: Wanghao <sxmatch1986@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sofia Enriquez <lsofia.enriquez@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5018727f8e18992e64c55b84f0d5b39ae7c70b32)

Conflicts:
	cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_ceph.py
Change-Id: I516b7c82b05b26e81195f7f106d43a9e0804082d
(cherry picked from commit 6cc8adb132b91be68c0b22c750417efb97f08ce0)

commit_message:
Add tmpwatch to the bootstrap

We always configure a tmpwatch cron as part of the logrotate-crond
container but we need to make sure it's installed in the case of
pre-deployed servers.

Change-Id: I48381c2972900c52fd68885026d4e64e9663d072
Closes-Bug: #1864118
(cherry picked from commit 9d00098c6a217f2cf1dc2fda93a026ecb5ffec88)

commit_message:
Port the os-bricks jobs to Zuul v3

All existing jobs are converted to native Zuul v3 versions.

os-brick-cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican has been removed
because it is a duplicate of cinder-tempest-plugin-lvm-lio-barbican
which does not test against the current os-brick.

os-brick-src-tempest-lvm-lio-barbican is in fact the same job,
but it tests against the os-brick codebase being tested.

Partial-Bug: #1853372

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/672804
Change-Id: I3e6b8f7fffff8aa2e9d4a3009374c74baa131405

commit_message:
Add diskimage-create arg for Octavia Git branch

Use `-g` to select the current Git branch to use for the amphora
build. This has historically been confusing for people, and this should
make it a little easier.

Change-Id: Iab01faaa17507c7bea399db7ee8f27f88d8de183

of Python installed, the interpreter used is the first

commit_message:
NodeDataLookup utility should rely on python env

This change ensures that if there are several versions
of Python installed, the interpreter used is the first
one on the environment's $PATH.

Change-Id: I48eec3d22e5a2a018554c6864efd52e4ab3c87ce
Related-Bug: #1854214
(cherry picked from commit a67981d1e8117c74c20adf3bc657eaf81cb8971a)

commit_message:
Introduce CephExternalMultiConfig

Add new parameter which may be used to configure an
overcloud to use more than one external Ceph cluster.

Change-Id: I23fc883ee243a34e1abd6914377b206160e5d52a
Depends-On: I4fd47445f012878e595649be8371ea212548cbd8
(cherry picked from commit 39a7b6754bcf508f286a2fe916b1c5eb94be7a06)

commit_message:
Fix dcn-hci resource mapping path

This change just fix the wrong dcn-hci mapping path
on the environment file.

Change-Id: I0913a479e306a69391d45f917667fb170692da09
Closes-Bug: #1864024
(cherry picked from commit ea9508b2fbaf13836a00f18cd51865daad51aa19)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-29 08:37:51.000000000', 'message': "Start removing ipxe support from the pxe interface

We have deprecated [pxe]ipxe_enabled for quite a time, using ipxe with
pxe interface is not recommended as we can see in this change that
clean_up_instance of pxe doesn't count for the ipxe configuration option.

The impact by simply removing the configuration option is quite large,
so the plan is to do it by smaller patches. This patch starts doing so
by moving the duplicated code in clean_up_instance to the PXEBaseMixin.

Change-Id: Ia621f38d9b6c4570ba6a62ddb8c72244ff3fe33b

commit_message:
Start removing ipxe support from the pxe interface

This patch starts removing codes related to ipxe support from the pxe interface,
and extract common logic to the PXEBaseMixin.

Story: 2007003
Task: 37779

Change-Id: Ia621f38d9b6c4570ba6a62ddb8c72244ff3fe33b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-19 13:26:56.000000000', 'message': "[stable-only] Cap msgpack for python 2

py27 job started to fail with:
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'encoding'

This failure comes with the new version of msgpack (1.0.0).

Since ceilometer does not use global upper-constraints.txt from
requirements repository, msgpack has to be constrained in
requirements.txt

Change-Id: I3ca76c80b96d49d4d256110c8fca13f9365add0d
"}, {'created': '2020-02-19 13:54:17.000000000', 'message': "[stable-only] Cap msgpack

periodic job py27 started to fail with:
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'encoding'

This failure comes with the new version of msgpack (1.0.0).

Since ceilometer does not use global upper-constraints.txt from
requirements repository, msgpack has to be constrained in
requirements.txt

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap msgpack

periodic job py27 started to fail with:
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'encoding'

This failure comes with the new version of msgpack (1.0.0).

Since ceilometer does not use global upper-constraints.txt from
requirements repository, msgpack has to be constrained in
requirements.txt

Change-Id: I3ca76c80b96d49d4d256110c8fca13f9365add0d

[{'created': '2020-02-20 13:47:47.000000000', 'message': 'Remove BlockStorageCinderVolume service from certain DCN roles

The ScaleOut roles should accompany the DistributedCompute roles
which are sufficient to provide the BlockStorageCinderVolume
service.

The DistributedCompute role supports usecases without persistent
storage via Cinder while the DistributedComputeHCI supports
usecases with persistent storage via Cinder. For those usecases
we want the BlockStorageCinderVolume service to be used by
DistributedComputeHCI with Ceph but not without Ceph as that
is presently the only Cinder backend supporting active/active.

Change-Id: I8588919cecc2be06447eba2b53b79d8d7cfc6a9e
Fixes-Bug: #1863799
(cherry picked from commit e81a3f8d36501253c925b8403d404a953a53466f)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove BlockStorageCinderVolume service from certain DCN roles

The ScaleOut roles should accompany the DistributedCompute roles
which are sufficient to provide the BlockStorageCinderVolume
service.

The DistributedCompute role supports usecases without persistent
storage via Cinder while the DistributedComputeHCI supports
usecases with persistent storage via Cinder. For those usecases
we want the BlockStorageCinderVolume service to be used by
DistributedComputeHCI with Ceph but not without Ceph as that
is presently the only Cinder backend supporting active/active.

Change-Id: I8588919cecc2be06447eba2b53b79d8d7cfc6a9e
Fixes-Bug: #1863799
(cherry picked from commit e81a3f8d36501253c925b8403d404a953a53466f)

commit_message:
just set necessary config options

There are many warning info in the Watcher api log file,
the reason is that keystonemiddleware only need config
section keystone_authtoken.
refer to https://docs.openstack.org/keystonemiddleware/latest/
Closes-Bug: #1864129

Change-Id: Ie790277d55b3a2d93c26781f7e5e8f66b87227d8

commit_message:
Remove centos-7 container for U

Since kolla has dropped py2 support in Usurri, we can should rely on the
centos-8 job from now on. This change makes the centos-7 job active only
for rocky, stien, and train.

Change-Id: I63784342843b540d48790601829da0159e1b50d9
Related-Bug: #1864018

commit_message:
Skip cryptsetup password quality checking

LUKS password quality checking is not useful
since we only use long hex strings for passwords.

Not skipping this means that we have to install
cracklib-dicts for cryptsetup to work, which is
unnecessary weight.

Closes-Bug: #1861120

Change-Id: Idc281be7cf88eeeeefe260877a1fc275d94f2bed
(cherry picked from commit afb7beb7ce98824d5fb789ad8e7577cebae4e41c)
(cherry picked from commit 6461c993bc24a07af0b4240aaccab50eaa018707)
(cherry picked from commit 0db2285387e32230471c81eef057c74436a9c82f)

commit_message:
Tell reno to ignore the kilo branch

This patch was adopted from Idd56c3f37d5786daae7181c36d38d267cbf1885c

Original description:
When reno 3.x runs under setuptools, it scans all of the branches it can
find, including any that look like they're closed and have an -eol tag.
The old kilo branch in this repository has a jumbled history that
somehow makes it look like it should include tags that it doesn't. We
know that there are no release notes in that branch, because reno wasn't
adopted while it was open. The releasenotes/source/index.rst links to
separate release notes in the wiki.

This patch tells reno to ignore that branch so that it doesn't throw an
exception when it gets confused about the old tag.

Change-Id: I28fd0fd499c40e33ff164fd643dadd6ac9009b17
Co-Authored-By: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-02-03 19:56:31.000000000', 'message': 'blacklist blockdiag 2.0.0

blockdiag has been used as an indirect dependcy via sphinx
for several releases. For the past few releases nova has monkey
patched blockdiag to around there global replacement of codec.getreader
under python 3.

The  2.0.0 broke how that monkey patching worked and also
was the first release in several years. Now that the project is active
again we have reported the python 3 issue to the maintainer and it
has been adressed in 2.0.1 which has now been released.

This change blacklists 2.0.0 and cap it at <3.0 so that projects
will not be broken by the next major release. This change does
not raise the minium requirement however nova can now raise its
minium requirement to blockdiag>=2.0.1 if it chooes too to allow
removal of monkey patching should it desire.

Other project are recommended to use 2.0.1 or later as this is the first
release which is python3 only and is compatiable with the sphinx extentions
we use without monkey patching.

commit_message:
blacklist blockdiag 2.0.0

blockdiag has been used as an indirect dependcy via some sphinx
extensions such as sphinxcontrib-blockdiag and sphinxcontrib-actdiag
for several releases. For the past few releases nova has monkey
patched blockdiag to work around there global replacement
of codec.getreader under python 3.

The 2.0.0 release broke how that monkey patching worked and also
was the first release in several years. Now that the project is active
again we have reported the python 3 issue to the maintainer
https://github.com/blockdiag/blockdiag/issues/126 and it
has been adressed by https://github.com/blockdiag/blockdiag/pull/129
in 2.0.1 which has now been released.
https://pypi.org/project/blockdiag/2.0.1/

This change blacklists 2.0.0. This change does not raise the minimum
requirement. Nova can selectively raise its minimum requirement in the
future in tree if it chooses to remove support for monkey patching
older releases.

Other project are recommended to use 2.0.1 or later as this is the first
release which is python3 only and is compatible with the sphinx
extentions we use without monkey patching.

Change-Id: I414d9e604616d49b4456ebc348418e9b1b09058b

commit_message:
devstack: Add support for IPv6 load balancer network

Allow to use IPv6 ULA subnet for amphora to controller communication.

Change-Id: I0254ee35cd8a5993e609b8b4e1a61ab98fe83b28

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-06 08:01:42.000000000', 'message': "Split connector list by platform

We'll keep separate lists of connectors for each of the supported
operating systems so that we don't end up trying to use unsupported
connectors.

Since Cinder is explicitly trying to use the iSCSI/FC connectors,
we'll have to include those as well, for now.

commit_message:
Split connector list by platform

We'll keep separate lists of connectors for each of the supported
operating systems so that we don't end up trying to use unsupported
connectors.

Since Cinder is explicitly trying to use the iSCSI/FC connectors,
we'll have to include those as well, for now.

(cherry picked from commit 9e8657dd6ef781d7e6027625fc2f05442256c6ac)
(cherry picked from commit 0927b72f685df52e632fa6bbe995e0549f6fca02)

Change-Id: Ibec2b798e8c5c3457cebea12cfd2f5813e62fb9e
Closes-Bug: #1850109

commit_message:
Pin designate-tempest-plugin for Stein/Rocky/Queens branches

Since Ib3bd70ba8f2e8386643c536ac8194fa99b54b842 and py2 testing drop,
this causes jobs in these branches to fail as designate-tempest-plugin
tries to install a python3-only version of dnspython

Use tag 0.7.0 for these branches, which is actually the previous commit
(so no changes in tests)

Also temporarily make neutron-tempest-plugin-bgpvpn-bagpipe non-voting,
it needs Ussuri beta releases and a networking-bagpipe fix [0]

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708648/

Change-Id: Ia2df06106419a45d56ff2de9193fe4e9c93ec62f
Closes-bug: #1864015

commit_message:
Use inspect instead of Inspector.from_engine()

SQLAlchemy is likely going to deprecate
Inspector.from_engine() which will start emitting a deprecation
warning in 1.4.   Use sqlalchemy.inspect() instead.

Change-Id: I287ba10f2e3308950b9caf6f51f3ee1db29a6448

[{'created': '2020-02-19 17:11:08.000000000', 'message': 'Skip cryptsetup password quality checking

LUKS password quality checking is not useful
since we only use long hex strings for passwords.

Not skipping this means that we have to install
cracklib-dicts for cryptsetup to work, which is
unnecessary weight.

Closes-Bug: #1861120

Change-Id: Idc281be7cf88eeeeefe260877a1fc275d94f2bed
(cherry picked from commit afb7beb7ce98824d5fb789ad8e7577cebae4e41c)
(cherry picked from commit 6461c993bc24a07af0b4240aaccab50eaa018707)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip cryptsetup password quality checking

LUKS password quality checking is not useful
since we only use long hex strings for passwords.

Not skipping this means that we have to install
cracklib-dicts for cryptsetup to work, which is
unnecessary weight.

Closes-Bug: #1861120

Change-Id: Idc281be7cf88eeeeefe260877a1fc275d94f2bed
(cherry picked from commit afb7beb7ce98824d5fb789ad8e7577cebae4e41c)
(cherry picked from commit 6461c993bc24a07af0b4240aaccab50eaa018707)

[{'account_id': 31651, 'date': '2020-02-20 20:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-02-20 20:20:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-02-20 20:37:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
manila: stop including all hosts in haproxy

We really only need the API services, not all of the Manila
hosts inside HAproxy.

Change-Id: Iaddaa1810becfbf267314f0a5090dc46cb0d567b
(cherry picked from commit 0b9a302a24f278b95848aa4a60c6665322292e8e)

commit_message:
Make yaml-validate.py work with new t-h-t layout

The yaml validation was not updated when the service yaml files were moved.
This updates the paths and filename patterns and fixes any issues exposed.

Change-Id: I41e15dae78159985801b4f2a62284a6d382e0a68
Closes-bug: #1848205

[ceph-client] Fix resource limit logic with rbd_pool job

This is to fix applying resource limit logic with rbd_pool job as this
job right now taking the values from ceph-mgr pod.

commit_message:
Fix service-type publishing

Add the secret, it was only in the parent but we need it for the run
playbook here.

Failure of promote job was:
"The task includes an option with an undefined variable. The error was:
'afs' is undefined".
This chane adds the variable afs.

Change-Id: I0244621fb1aa57354c619735a20e2a2789de13aa

commit_message:
Minor cleanup to test publishing

Remove now obsolete python 2.7.x support from setup.py,
update pbr version and make dependency explicit via requirements.txt

This change was pushed to test that the dependent change fixes
publishing content to https://service-types.openstack.org/ . So,
please merge once dependency is in and then we can check that publishing
to server works correctly.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/709060
Change-Id: Iac2be67dbef5510679f5cda658b591e52d537051

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-15 10:29:02.000000000', 'message': "Print help if nova-manage subcommand is not specified

If a nova-manage command is executed without the -h option
or a subcommand the user gets an ugly traceback. This is
easily recreated:

  $ tox -e venv -- nova-manage db

Make the action argument required, so we get a helpful error message
instead.

  $ nova-manage db
  usage: nova-manage db [-h]
                      {archive_deleted_rows,ironic_flavor_migration,
                       null_instance_uuid_scan,online_data_migrations,
                       purge,sync,version}
                      ...
  nova-manage db: error: the following arguments are required: action

Note that unit tests appear to be impossible for this, since doing so
attempts to initialize an oslo.config 'CONF' singleton and this is
something we've already done in 'nova.test' and can't do again.

Change-Id: I24d03eed3aa3b882c49916938f4c25d76fd4e831
Closes-Bug: #1837199
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 51b0d4ca58f70fdd887dd053bfae1b2c918c33ba)
"}]
commit_message:
Print help if nova-manage subcommand is not specified

If a nova-manage command is executed without the -h option
or a subcommand the user gets an ugly traceback. This is
easily recreated:

  $ tox -e venv -- nova-manage db

Make the action argument required, so we get a helpful error message
instead.

  $ nova-manage db
  usage: nova-manage db [-h]
                      {archive_deleted_rows,ironic_flavor_migration,
                       null_instance_uuid_scan,online_data_migrations,
                       purge,sync,version}
                      ...
  nova-manage db: error: the following arguments are required: action

Note that unit tests appear to be impossible for this, since doing so
attempts to initialize an oslo.config 'CONF' singleton and this is
something we've already done in 'nova.test' and can't do again.

Change-Id: I24d03eed3aa3b882c49916938f4c25d76fd4e831
Closes-Bug: #1837199
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 51b0d4ca58f70fdd887dd053bfae1b2c918c33ba)

'uwsgi-plugin-python3' package is required for
Ubuntu/Debian deployments.

Closes-Bug: #1861688

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-21 17:45:45.000000000', 'message': "Ensure ruamel is included when we build test environments

This change ensures that we include ruamel.yaml when we build test
environments, which is required for docs. This module used to be
included elsewhere however, due to recent dependency changes the
package was dropped somwhere along the way.

The docs test will now run anytime change change is made to our
requirements files. This will ensure we're not running into these
types of failures in the future.

Change-Id: If3d65944a4e71fc8fba926fd0956a73429fbb172
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure ruamel is included when we build test environments

This change ensures that we include ruamel.yaml when we build test
environments, which is required for docs. This module used to be
included elsewhere however, due to recent dependency changes the
package was dropped somwhere along the way.

The docs test will now run anytime change change is made to our
requirements files. This will ensure we're not running into these
types of failures in the future.

Change-Id: If3d65944a4e71fc8fba926fd0956a73429fbb172
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

We have seen race conditions in Ansible/Systemd where the unit file

commit_message:
tripleo_container_manage: add systemd testcase for service reload

Add a test that update a container managed by systemd; with a new image.
The container should be removed and re-created; and its systemd files.

We have seen race conditions in Ansible/Systemd where the unit file
could not be found. This patch will prevent that to happen thanks to a
functional test.

Change-Id: I7b7392f68d7f5b4b991c5238e7abd40d72a08b10
(cherry picked from commit 75ca603b159a9807b047fe1e4b6a02035e0e731b)

commit_message:
podman/systemd: manage timer requires

To match with how Paunch created the systemd services for containers, we
add the requires so the timers require their service to run for proper
healthchecks. We also need to run a systemd reload right after.

Change-Id: Icc14d4f3bf137a543d9ef4f6a2f6384d9df65a70
(cherry picked from commit 99b0105a09da36d98dd17b65802ef23c6b6f0228)

commit_message:
tripleo_container_rm: also remove systemd requires when they exist

Containers managed by systemd might have some .requires files for their
healthchecks. Make sure we also cleanup these files.

Change-Id: I576f5077dd82ac96290d56603dcbb70347366d65
(cherry picked from commit edc8fa1cda3a28711c7445f5e77e943a84a5fa98)

subject: Change /run bind mount for neutron/openvswitch
messages: [{'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-02-21 19:15:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-02-21 19:15:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-02-21 19:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-21 19:15:06.000000000', 'message': 'Change /run bind mount for neutron/openvswitch

Currently we have a very wide /run mount for all Neutron/OVS services,
which allows sudo/rootwrap to contact with the hosts dbus - all symptoms
are documented in the related bug.

Since we use tcp connections to OVS from Neutron agents - removing
bind mounts.

Closes-Bug: #1861792

(cherry picked from commit 227008cf68aa68f340d95703e85355ae81585506)
(cherry picked from commit 8be74eb8cb8c177dd2c2ac23ea9b8a4edccb6e87)

Change-Id: I46d8cf046ef3f4718cbe30561d1764560803e2a1
'}, {'created': '2020-02-21 19:15:59.000000000', 'message': 'Change /run bind mount for neutron/openvswitch

Currently we have a very wide /run mount for all Neutron/OVS services,
which allows sudo/rootwrap to contact with the hosts dbus - all symptoms
are documented in the related bug.

Since we use tcp connections to OVS from Neutron agents - removing
bind mounts.

Closes-Bug: #1861792

(cherry picked from commit 227008cf68aa68f340d95703e85355ae81585506)

Change-Id: I46d8cf046ef3f4718cbe30561d1764560803e2a1
'}]
commit_message:
Change /run bind mount for neutron/openvswitch

Currently we have a very wide /run mount for all Neutron/OVS services,
which allows sudo/rootwrap to contact with the hosts dbus - all symptoms
are documented in the related bug.

Since we use tcp connections to OVS from Neutron agents - removing
bind mounts.

Closes-Bug: #1861792

(cherry picked from commit 227008cf68aa68f340d95703e85355ae81585506)

Change-Id: I46d8cf046ef3f4718cbe30561d1764560803e2a1

tmpwatch needs to be installed in the case of deployed server. In newer

commit_message:
[Stein-only] add no_log to the podman login

We don't want to log the podman login information so let's add no_log.

Also add a tripleo_podman_debug variable that can be used to enable
login in case of emergency.

Change-Id: I80a903479f3e9c0fde67f3d59f54b2d7b7c69eef

commit_message:
NodeDataLookup utility should rely on python env

This change ensures that if there are several versions
of Python installed, the interpreter used is the first
one on the environment's $PATH.

Change-Id: I48eec3d22e5a2a018554c6864efd52e4ab3c87ce
Related-Bug: #1854214
(cherry picked from commit a67981d1e8117c74c20adf3bc657eaf81cb8971a)

commit_message:
Store the FIP associated to a port in the OVN Northbound db.

If a floating ip is associated to a port, it will be stored as
Logical_Switch_Port.external_ids:neutron:port_fip=FIP

OVN octavia driver will use this information to associate the floating ip
to the load balancer vip if the port is a virtual ip port created by
OVN octavia driver.

Change-Id: Ia63a375e360fb7b1ee31e4d9f96b38d9f31f4096
Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Józefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c8e8cdbb4b38afe70ff1d36044bab05e30ddc7e5)
(cherry picked from commit 3e90354f11a3e5b4499499ba8cedd33721a6c011)

commit_message:
Release openstack-doc-tools, os-api-ref,openstackdocstheme

Release new versions that drop Python 2.7 support and include a few
fixes.
Use new major version for them due to Python 2.7 removal.

These repos are now part of oslo, update team tag.

Change-Id: Ica9ff1e4fa2da0343419288be303901a697985bc

commit_message:
NodeDataLookup utility should rely on python env

This change ensures that if there are several versions
of Python installed, the interpreter used is the first
one on the environment's $PATH.

Change-Id: I48eec3d22e5a2a018554c6864efd52e4ab3c87ce
Related-Bug: #1854214
(cherry picked from commit a67981d1e8117c74c20adf3bc657eaf81cb8971a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-17 15:24:34.000000000', 'message': 'Enhance service restart in functional env

Bugfix Icaf1bae8cb040b939f916a19ce026031ddb84af7 showed that restarting
a compute service in the functional env is unrealistic causing faults
to slip through. During that bug fix only the minimal change was done
in the functional env regarding compute service restart to reproduce
the reported fault. However the restart of the compute service could
be made even more realistic.

This patch simulates a compute service restart in the functional env
by stopping the original compute service and starting a totally new
compute service for the same host and node. This way we can make sure
that we get a brand new ComputeManager in the new service and no
state can leak between the old and the new service.

This change revealed another shortcoming of the functional env.
In the real world the nova-compute service could be restarted without
loosing any running servers on the compute host. But with the naive
implementation of this change the compute service is re-created. This
means that a new ComputeManager is instantiated that loads a new
FakeDriver instance as well. That new FakeDriver instance then reports
an empty hypervisor. This behavior is not totally unrealistic as it
simulates such a compute host restart that cleans the hypervisor state
as well (e.g. compute host redeployment). However this type of restart
shows another bug in the code path that destroys and deallocates
evacuated instance from the source host. Therefore this patch
implements the compute service restart in a way that simulates only a
service restart and not a full compute restart. A subsequent patch will
add a test that uses the clean hypervisor case to reproduces the
revealed bug.

Related-Bug: #1724172

On stable/stein:

Closes-Bug: #1859766

Change-Id: I9d6cd6259659a35383c0c9c21db72a9434ba86b1
(cherry picked from commit 2794748d9c58623045023f34c7793c58ce41447c)

an empty hypervisor. This behavior is not totally unrealistic as it
simulates such a compute host restart that cleans the hypervisor state
as well (e.g. compute host redeployment). However this type of restart
shows another bug in the code path that destroys and deallocates
evacuated instance from the source host. Therefore this patch

Related-Bug: #1724172

On stable/stein:

Closes-Bug: #1859766

Note: mock package import added to nova/test.py (due to not having patch
Ibe7cb29620f06d31059f2a5f94ca180b8671046e in stable/stein)

Change-Id: I9d6cd6259659a35383c0c9c21db72a9434ba86b1
(cherry picked from commit 2794748d9c58623045023f34c7793c58ce41447c)

commit_message:
Enhance service restart in functional env

Bugfix Icaf1bae8cb040b939f916a19ce026031ddb84af7 showed that restarting
a compute service in the functional env is unrealistic causing faults
to slip through. During that bug fix only the minimal change was done
in the functional env regarding compute service restart to reproduce
the reported fault. However the restart of the compute service could
be made even more realistic.

This patch simulates a compute service restart in the functional env
by stopping the original compute service and starting a totally new
compute service for the same host and node. This way we can make sure
that we get a brand new ComputeManager in the new service and no
state can leak between the old and the new service.

This change revealed another shortcoming of the functional env.
In the real world the nova-compute service could be restarted without
loosing any running servers on the compute host. But with the naive
implementation of this change the compute service is re-created. This
means that a new ComputeManager is instantiated that loads a new
FakeDriver instance as well. That new FakeDriver instance then reports
an empty hypervisor. This behavior is not totally unrealistic as it
simulates such a compute host restart that cleans the hypervisor state
as well (e.g. compute host redeployment). However this type of restart
shows another bug in the code path that destroys and deallocates
evacuated instance from the source host. Therefore this patch
implements the compute service restart in a way that simulates only a
service restart and not a full compute restart. A subsequent patch will
add a test that uses the clean hypervisor case to reproduces the
revealed bug.

Related-Bug: #1724172

On stable/stein:

Closes-Bug: #1859766

Note: mock package import added to nova/test.py (due to not having patch
Ibe7cb29620f06d31059f2a5f94ca180b8671046e in stable/stein)

Change-Id: I9d6cd6259659a35383c0c9c21db72a9434ba86b1
(cherry picked from commit 2794748d9c58623045023f34c7793c58ce41447c)

commit_message:
Use python3 devstack ceph plugin job

devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest job is py2 job and
not supposed to run on master gate. We need to use
its py3 version- devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3

Change-Id: I1a817c8dc0d01292bdd89cd46caa094d1ecdad01

commit_message:
Add files-container option for stack create and update

If files-container option is specified:

- All template/env files would be fetched by the heat engine
  relative to the files_container and no local files other
  than the root template would be sent to server.
- Relative path of environment files would be sent in the
  environment_files list.

Also adds the option to template validate.

Change-Id: I1a703ab8798a003365be650886bb78be5af472b7
Story: #1755453
Task: 19319

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-19 16:22:37.000000000', 'message': "Optimize playbook for speed

The cli-enable-ssh-admin.yaml makes several API intensive calls to heat and neutron,
so to speed things up we're using ansible async. This change moves our api intensive
calls to the top of the playbooks and blocks on their completion before they're
needed. By doing this we'll improve the overall playbook execution time.

Change-Id: I1c73e5de08206338a513b6c0ec2af61dea44b859
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize playbook for speed

The cli-enable-ssh-admin.yaml makes several API intensive calls to heat and neutron,
so to speed things up we're using ansible async. This change moves our api intensive
calls to the top of the playbooks and blocks on their completion before they're
needed. By doing this we'll improve the overall playbook execution time.

Change-Id: I1c73e5de08206338a513b6c0ec2af61dea44b859
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove namespace_security_groups from opts.py

[1] removed namespace security groups, but did not do so from opts.py.
This breaks config file generation (see tox -egenconfig).

[1] - https://review.opendev.org/703440

Change-Id: I54f4213d21037f3c45330d0ce56414262b0e1d87

subject: Change /run bind mount for neutron/openvswitch
messages: [{'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-02-21 11:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-02-21 11:48:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-02-21 16:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-21 11:46:31.000000000', 'message': 'Change /run bind mount for neutron/openvswitch

Currently we have a very wide /run mount for all Neutron/OVS services,
which allows sudo/rootwrap to contact with the hosts dbus - all symptoms
are documented in the related bug.

Since we use tcp connections to OVS from Neutron agents - removing
bind mounts.

Closes-Bug: #1861792

Change-Id: Ifee4bec7b2e9ef4e2d624b1411f1a9e6332325c6
(cherry picked from commit 227008cf68aa68f340d95703e85355ae81585506)
'}]
commit_message:
Change /run bind mount for neutron/openvswitch

Currently we have a very wide /run mount for all Neutron/OVS services,
which allows sudo/rootwrap to contact with the hosts dbus - all symptoms
are documented in the related bug.

Since we use tcp connections to OVS from Neutron agents - removing
bind mounts.

Closes-Bug: #1861792

Change-Id: Ifee4bec7b2e9ef4e2d624b1411f1a9e6332325c6
(cherry picked from commit 227008cf68aa68f340d95703e85355ae81585506)

commit_message:
Exposed beat logging levels

The elastic beats are currently deployed with a default logging level of
info, which can produce large amounts of data, particularly in the
case that beats are monitoring one another's logs, and then logging this fact.
This commit exposes the configuration, allowing it to be set by the
variable log_level. The default level is unchanged.

Change-Id: Idbf715fc99450003920a45323123fcba919f2a83

the expection here is that in real deployments the value will indeed be set externally, and match across all charts - which would both pod churn during deployment/upgrade and also provide continutity of cache during such events. This commit simply provides a mechanism to ensure that we dont inadvertantly store sensitive data in memcached without some encryption - even if the cache is effectlively rendered useless. That said - we should perhaps consider setting a default value 'insecure' or similar rather than null?"}]

commit_message:
Revert "Keystone Authtoken Cache: allow universal secret key to be set"

This reverts commit 1c85fdc390e05eb578874e77fad9d4ec942da791.

Do not use randomly generated strings in configmaps as this leads to
whole helm release redeployment even no values are changed. The random
items have to be generated outside of helm chart and provided via
values.
Also previous behaviour didn't allow to use cache during rolling upgrade
as new pods were spawned with new key.

Change-Id: I423611b18fca0d65e2e721a9c6a0c3d8df0813d2

commit_message:
Implements KeyManager's option discovery.

The KeyManager itself should be responsible for advertising the
correct set of options for discovery, not relying on the global
option listing method to know which variable holds the options
and how are they grouped.

Change-Id: I1764c383206df835b7d654f2f776663bd6d4d25b
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Centralize traffic when LB and member has FIP

When Load Balancer and its member has FIP assigned
and environment is configured to use DVR the member
FIP needs to be centralized. It is current core OVN
limitation, that should be solved in [1].

This patch adds this mechanism to OVN Client.
It covers cases:

1) FIP association on port that is a member of
   some LB - make it centralized.
2) FIP association on LB VIP - find a members
   FIPs and centralized them.
3) The reverse of each of the above cases.

Related-Bug: #1860662

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1793897

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py
    networking_ovn/common/constants.py
    networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.p

Change-Id: I254f0ac28f7585b699a8238e01ffb37dd70282ef
(cherry picked from commit 57ac38921efa6bbf0bc4a22950355256cc3ebe6d)

commit_message:
Store the FIP associated to a port in the OVN Northbound db.

If a floating ip is associated to a port, it will be stored as
Logical_Switch_Port.external_ids:neutron:port_fip=FIP

OVN octavia driver will use this information to associate the floating ip
to the load balancer vip if the port is a virtual ip port created by
OVN octavia driver.

Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Józefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c8e8cdbb4b38afe70ff1d36044bab05e30ddc7e5)

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/tests/unit/fakes.py

Change-Id: Ia63a375e360fb7b1ee31e4d9f96b38d9f31f4096

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-28 18:26:42.000000000', 'message': 'Adding niet.

* Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, this module is actively maintained.

* Is the library good code? We would certainly like to think so.

This module is open-source and we would welcome reviews and comments.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes, the third-party CI at https://travis-ci.org/openuado/niet runs the
tests using Python 3.7 on Ubuntu 16.04 (Xenial).

* Is the library license compatible?

Yes, this module is under a MIT license.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Not yet. We intend to add them to Debian and, hence, Ubuntu, and also for Fedora.

* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?

No; there is no other package that offers similar functionality.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup?

Not yet; The goal of adding this to global-requirements is to subsequently add
niet usage to shell scripts to be able to use its powerful features.

* If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it
use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

N/A

Change-Id: I2117fd493ea7216f1a804a8abc544a4dddbba3ac
'}]
commit_message:
Adding niet.

* Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, this module is actively maintained.

* Is the library good code? We would certainly like to think so.

This module is open-source and we would welcome reviews and comments.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes, the third-party CI at https://travis-ci.org/openuado/niet runs the
tests using Python 3.7 on Ubuntu 16.04 (Xenial).

* Is the library license compatible?

Yes, this module is under a MIT license.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Not yet. We intend to add them to Debian and, hence, Ubuntu, and also for Fedora.

* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?

No; there is no other package that offers similar functionality.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup?

Not yet; The goal of adding this to global-requirements is to subsequently add
niet usage to shell scripts to be able to use its powerful features.

* If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it
use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

N/A

Change-Id: I2117fd493ea7216f1a804a8abc544a4dddbba3ac

[{'created': '2020-02-20 10:25:09.000000000', 'message': "Support volume transfer `name` filters

The `name` filter for volume transfer is not currently recognized by the
API. Instead, it allowed filtering on 'display_name', which is not the
actual name of any attribute of the resource.
This patch adds the support for it while secretly continuing to
support `display_name` as a valid filter so as not to break people who
have figured out the workaround.

Change-Id: I6a4d12d5dd55080e9aa73027ed82d3bf13855e28
Closes-Bug: #1860100
(cherry picked from commit 41b0eb23516b2ac66f89a7d5f7e33968082a05cc)
"}]
commit_message:
Support volume transfer `name` filters

The `name` filter for volume transfer is not currently recognized by the
API. Instead, it allowed filtering on 'display_name', which is not the
actual name of any attribute of the resource.
This patch adds the support for it while secretly continuing to
support `display_name` as a valid filter so as not to break people who
have figured out the workaround.

Change-Id: I6a4d12d5dd55080e9aa73027ed82d3bf13855e28
Closes-Bug: #1860100
(cherry picked from commit 41b0eb23516b2ac66f89a7d5f7e33968082a05cc)

commit_message:
Tests: hacking check tweaks

Remove reference to non-existent cinder/tests/tempest.

Don't scan non-test code for C313 assert checks.

Remove some regexes that are no longer used.

Change-Id: Ie1a42b9b1552eb2b28bc69fd1fe4f7c5ef2fe6ae

We've started using tripleo-common and other client libraries in custom
ansible modules. Should be there in requirements.

subject: tripleo_container_manage: add systemd testcase for service reload
messages: [{'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-02-21 03:52:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-02-21 13:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-02-21 14:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-21 03:52:34.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo_container_manage: add systemd testcase for service reload

Add a test that update a container managed by systemd; with a new image.
The container should be removed and re-created; and its systemd files.

We have seen race conditions in Ansible/Systemd where the unit file
could not be found. This patch will prevent that to happen thanks to a
functional test.

Change-Id: I7b7392f68d7f5b4b991c5238e7abd40d72a08b10
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo_container_manage: add systemd testcase for service reload

Add a test that update a container managed by systemd; with a new image.
The container should be removed and re-created; and its systemd files.

We have seen race conditions in Ansible/Systemd where the unit file
could not be found. This patch will prevent that to happen thanks to a
functional test.

Change-Id: I7b7392f68d7f5b4b991c5238e7abd40d72a08b10

subject: Add tmpwatch to the bootstrap
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-20 22:35:15.000000000', 'message': "Add tmpwatch to the bootstrap

We always configure a tmpwatch cron as part of the logrotate-crond
container but we need to make sure it's installed in the case of
pre-deployed servers.

Change-Id: I48381c2972900c52fd68885026d4e64e9663d072
Closes-Bug: #1864118
"}]
commit_message:
Add tmpwatch to the bootstrap

We always configure a tmpwatch cron as part of the logrotate-crond
container but we need to make sure it's installed in the case of
pre-deployed servers.

Change-Id: I48381c2972900c52fd68885026d4e64e9663d072
Closes-Bug: #1864118

commit_message:
tripleo_container_rm: also remove systemd requires when they exist

Containers managed by systemd might have some .requires files for their
healthchecks. Make sure we also cleanup these files.

commit_message:
Improve the way of handling inventory for ansible_runner

In TripleO we have different ways to provide inventory for ansible
depending on the features:
update/upgrade gives a yaml dump, validation and undercloud
gives a str with the hostnames, the standalone gives a file.

This small private function aims to handle all that case in
order to provide the same way to ansible runner: an ansible
artifact written under artifacts temp directory

Change-Id: I454aa483aa069806ba6b149997804df8a507a4d0

commit_message:
Fix promote-service-types-authority

This job only publishes part of the directory and needs to keep old content
around. Thus, add a new promote playbook that uses the
upload-afs-synchronize rule to not delete old content like the normal
playbook in the parent does.

Change-Id: I13f9faf698ec459f1d7cd7a950172d836b470a4c

Andy,
Is it possible that the environment is already running a rabbit broker on 5672?  IOW, there's two rabbits: one started by the host using default port 5672 and the one our test creates (port 5682)?

If so the dispatch router would exit immediately, but since the log isn't available for us to view it's hard to tell..."}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2019-12-20 17:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2019-12-20 20:35:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-07 14:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-07 16:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-07 16:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-07 17:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-12 19:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2020-01-13 14:41:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-21 13:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-21 13:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-21 13:59:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-21 14:00:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-21 14:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-21 14:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-22 14:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-01-22 17:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-01-23 10:29:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22:

Hello,

scenario002 and scenario004 failed, the both are kafka based so maybe we have an issue related to the kafka setup...

Maybe I missed something but the given logs are not enough verbose to understand why tests fails, I've an idea?

You definied `set -e` in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677744/22/tools/setup-scenario-env.sh so maybe something went wrong during `_setup_kafka` and it exit with error and then your script trap the error and stop its execution.

By example with the wget in `_setup_kafka`, requesting a wrong url or requesting against a server not available could exit in error here.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 20523, 'date': '2020-02-05 13:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-10 14:59:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

(1 comment)

Hello,

See my questions inline'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2020-02-13 17:43:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

I'm tentatively +2 this patch as it stands.

The Kafka tests have been failing prior to this patch, so I wouldn't necessarily hold this up for them.  I'm good with a follow up patch to address the Kafka issues.

What I *do* want is to at least get scenario03 to be voting.  This scenario uses the amqp1 driver which has been inadvertently broken in the past due to the fact that the functional test was non-voting due to instability.

So I'd like to see this upstream, then fix the kafka stuff afterwards.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-21 14:12:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I'm tentatively +2 this patch as it stands.
 > 
 > The Kafka tests have been failing prior to this patch, so I
 > wouldn't necessarily hold this up for them.  I'm good with a follow
 > up patch to address the Kafka issues.
 > 
 > What I *do* want is to at least get scenario03 to be voting.  This
 > scenario uses the amqp1 driver which has been inadvertently broken
 > in the past due to the fact that the functional test was non-voting
 > due to instability.
 > 
 > So I'd like to see this upstream, then fix the kafka stuff
 > afterwards.
 > 
 > Thoughts?

I'm ok with that, let's go to address them in a follow up patch"}]

'}, {'created': '2020-01-07 16:50:24.000000000', 'message': 'Setup backend scenarios for functional tests

This patchset introduces scenarios for the functional tests to unify the
setup and configuration of alternate messaging backends for RPC and
Notifications. The scenarios are defined to reduce redundancy in
the testing of backends and to demonstrate functional correctness
across driver combinations.

Current driver support:
rabbit - RPC, Notify
amqp   - RPC
kafka  - Notify

                  RPC       Notify
               ---------  ----------
scenario01       rabbit     rabbit
scenario02       rabbit     kafka
scenario03        amqp      rabbit
scenario04        amqp      kafka

It is anticipated that additional scenarios will be defined as new
drivers are introduced and/or new messaging intermediarites are supported.

commit_message:
Setup backend scenarios for functional tests

This patchset introduces scenarios for the functional tests to unify the
setup and configuration of alternate messaging backends for RPC and
Notifications. The scenarios are defined to reduce redundancy in
the testing of backends and to demonstrate functional correctness
across driver combinations.

Current driver support:
rabbit - RPC, Notify
amqp   - RPC
kafka  - Notify

                  RPC       Notify
               ---------  ----------
scenario01       rabbit     rabbit
scenario02       rabbit     kafka
scenario03        amqp      rabbit
scenario04        amqp      kafka

It is anticipated that additional scenarios will be defined as new
drivers are introduced and/or new messaging intermediarites are supported.

Note: The removal of python2 jobs are also included patch

Change-Id: I0f86416623a0b718516147f0660b4df2b74cf867

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

oswin-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I1e570f003a55fcbb3d4a628f788d5b34b76671db
