I've submitted patches to implement the exact same logic in openstacklib[1][2].

I'll remove my -1 as these could be regarded as follow-up, and I'll leave the decision for other core reviewers because we already have +2 on this."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-01-31 08:40:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Problem is that this would be backportable (even though it's a behavior change right? Will affect existing deployments) while changing openstacklib would add a dependency for puppet-keystone to a new minimum version of openstacklib (which is even worse imo)

And I'm assuming here people want to backport this?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-31 14:42:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

We could just backport the openstacklib bit and not this. One might argue this was a performance regression so backporting it may be justified.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-02-01 13:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-02-01 13:50:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-02-01 13:52:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Please correct me if I'm doing a thing different from what you expect."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-02-03 10:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

Because; how are we suppose to notify users that there is a new minimum openstacklib versions for this release? revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-10 19:44:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix performance regression due to reduced number os keystone workers

https://github.com/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/ace7aeb3b71b39a59f92fbc9e7f676a70c9a797a#diff-e5968f40345cf5d3be0539fbba87f787
moved all actions to the same keystone API consoloidating the different keystone-main and keystone-admin workers that were present earlier
into the "keystone" workers. As a result, we see a performance regression[0] in actions like creating and listing users/tenants, as
THT/puppet-keystone deploys # of keystone workers = min(max(cpucores/2,2),12) as in https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/master/lib/facter/os_workers.rb#L33
which would now be only half of what was deployed earlier due to the consolidation of separate keystone-main and keystone-admin workers into one "keystone" worker.
For exampme, on an 8 core machines, in earlier versions, 4 keystone-main and 4 keystone-admin workers would be spawned, but now we only have 4 "keystone" workers
and due to the difference in the number of workers deployed by default, users will be a drop in the out of box performance.

This patch not only brings performance back to the previous levels, it is also safe to implement as we are not changing the # of workers when compared to previous releases
and oinly bringing parity.

Change-Id: Icf9acaa106af705fa249a2ef2abca9f9a91fba59

Change-Id: Icf9acaa106af705fa249a2ef2abca9f9a91fba59
'}, {'created': '2020-01-21 14:24:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix performance regression due to reduced number of keystone workers

The puppet-keystone project consolidated keystone applications:

  https://github.com/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/ace7aeb3b71b39a59f92fbc9e7f676a70c9a797a#diff-e5968f40345cf5d3be0539fbba87f787

This effectively reduces the number of available workers to process
keystone requests since only half the processes are deployed now that
the applications are consolidated [0]. As a result, we see a performance
regression [1] when interacting with keystone.

For example, in earlier versions, an 8 core machine would spawn four
processes to serve the keystone-main application. Another four processes
would be spawned to serve the keystone-admin application. Now, we only
have 4 processes total to serve the entire keystone application. Due to
the difference in the number of workers deployed by default, users will
experience reduced performance out-of-the-box.

This patch not only brings performance back to the previous levels, it
is also safe to implement as we are not changing the number of workers
when compared to previous releases and only bringing parity.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/master/lib/facter/os_workers.rb#L33
[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1789495

Change-Id: Icf9acaa106af705fa249a2ef2abca9f9a91fba59

commit_message:
Fix performance regression due to reduced number of keystone workers

The puppet-keystone project consolidated keystone applications:

  https://github.com/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/ace7aeb3b71b39a59f92fbc9e7f676a70c9a797a#diff-e5968f40345cf5d3be0539fbba87f787

This effectively reduces the number of available workers to process
keystone requests since only half the processes are deployed now that
the applications are consolidated [0]. As a result, we see a performance
regression [1] when interacting with keystone.

For example, in earlier versions, an 8 core machine would spawn four
processes to serve the keystone-main application. Another four processes
would be spawned to serve the keystone-admin application. Now, we only
have 4 processes total to serve the entire keystone application. Due to
the difference in the number of workers deployed by default, users will
experience reduced performance out-of-the-box.

This patch not only brings performance back to the previous levels, it
is also safe to implement as we are not changing the number of workers
when compared to previous releases and only bringing parity.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/blob/master/lib/facter/os_workers.rb#L33
[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1789495

Co-Authored-By: Takashi Kajinami <tkajinam@redhat.com>
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705041/
Change-Id: Icf9acaa106af705fa249a2ef2abca9f9a91fba59

I think there is a bug here.
Test "test_migration_files" fails, however, it should not run at all.
The test should only run on NFS storage protocol and in out case it's iSCSI.
I reported a bug and upload a patch for this.
  - https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1859763
  - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/702601/'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2020-01-15 10:12:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2020-01-15 10:29:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

>>lvm job failure is early in devstack-gate and has nothing to do with manila tempest

>> I think there is a bug here.
>> Test "test_migration_files" fails, however, it should not run at all.
>> The test should only run on NFS storage protocol and in out case it's iSCSI.

Well the first run in this patch set had a test failure in devstack gate, before manila was set up.

W.r.t. the second run, after the recheck, the migration tests are quite flaky, have intermittent failures, and need work.  The lvm back end uses NFS protocol in Manila: an LVM volume is set up to hold data and exported via NFS.  In Cinder, LVM back end uses iSCSI to carry scsi commands for attaching the LVM volume as a block device but iSCSI does not provide shared file system access and there is no iSCSI in Manila.

You can see the lvm job pass including migration test cases with the existing skip logic here [1].

So I rechecked again.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697957/'}, {'account_id': 19262, 'date': '2020-01-15 10:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Move all conditions skipped under "skip_checks" method

Manila tempest plugin class structure should be compatible
with tempest project as manila tempest plugin is a plugin
of tempest.
In some cases incompatibility can cause problems.
For example: using "check_uuid" tool for generating UUIDs
for tests does not work properly in manila, Because some
classes are wrapped with conditions skipped.
I suggest to use "skip_checks" method that been used to
evaluate config before tests methods and skip them based
on these checks.

This patch moves all conditions under this method.

Two new functions been added to "skip_checks" method
in order to skip by microversions and reduce a duplicated
code:
  - "check_skip_with_microversion"
  - "check_skip_with_microversion_not_supported"

Change-Id: Id0a15dbfbd3d85d7773c26e252f4cc4d906cf377

[{'created': '2020-02-17 11:20:33.000000000', 'message': 'Delegate identity provider setup to service setup host

This patch delegates tasks setting up a keystone identity provider to the
keystone_service_setup_host becasue the ansible modules used require the
python-keystoneclient module. These tasks will fail when the keystone
(container) host is not the deploy host as python-keystoneclient will
be missing.

These tasks have recently been refactored in a previous patch [1] to use
the os_* ansible modules instead of the OSA specific keystone module.
This patch fixes a reported bug with the old code which is also present
after that refactoring.

Change-Id: I16a61501a0578e87464e8bd1031af4270eac2d98
Closes-Bug: #1856165
(cherry picked from commit 8a31f80e35a4ebad83da260679952a823bf9fbf9)
'}]
commit_message:
Delegate identity provider setup to service setup host

This patch delegates tasks setting up a keystone identity provider to the
keystone_service_setup_host becasue the ansible modules used require the
python-keystoneclient module. These tasks will fail when the keystone
(container) host is not the deploy host as python-keystoneclient will
be missing.

These tasks have recently been refactored in a previous patch [1] to use
the os_* ansible modules instead of the OSA specific keystone module.
This patch fixes a reported bug with the old code which is also present
after that refactoring.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656397/

Change-Id: I16a61501a0578e87464e8bd1031af4270eac2d98
Closes-Bug: #1856165
(cherry picked from commit 8a31f80e35a4ebad83da260679952a823bf9fbf9)

Currently metricbeat will always enable checks for raid as part of the

commit_message:
Use service_facts to check mdmonitor existence

Currently metricbeat will always enable checks for raid as part of the
system module metricset for physical hosts. This causes error logs and
generates noise for physical hosts without raid enabled. This change
checks that the mdmonitor.service is running before adding a raid check
to the system module metricset.

Change-Id: I2b96c30d2eec2c83787035a100a0fa29aedbf333

subject: Use service_facts to check haproxy existence
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-18 17:15:26.000000000', 'message': 'Use service_facts to check haproxy existence

It is currently the case that at deploy time, the existence of a
/etc/haproxy directory is used to check whether or not haproxy is
running. This is used to check whether or not to enable the haproxy
module. This will cause frequent errors on metricbeat if haproxy is
installed but not running, as the endpoint will not be active. This
commit uses the service_facts modules to detect whether or not the
service is running at deploy time, and therefore whether or not to
enable the module.

Change-Id: If0e513e04d3dc567cedd16b440dc2771fddbbb5d
'}, {'created': '2020-02-19 10:24:24.000000000', 'message': 'Use service_facts to check haproxy existence

It is currently the case that at deploy time, the existence of a
/etc/haproxy directory is used to check whether or not haproxy is
running. This is used to check whether or not to enable the haproxy
module. This will cause frequent errors on metricbeat if haproxy is
installed but not running, as the endpoint will not be active. This
commit uses the service_facts modules to detect whether or not the
service is running at deploy time, and therefore whether or not to
enable the module.

Change-Id: If0e513e04d3dc567cedd16b440dc2771fddbbb5d
'}]
commit_message:
Use service_facts to check haproxy existence

It is currently the case that at deploy time, the existence of a
/etc/haproxy directory is used to check whether or not haproxy is
running. This is used to check whether or not to enable the haproxy
module. This will cause frequent errors on metricbeat if haproxy is
installed but not running, as the endpoint will not be active. This
commit uses the service_facts modules to detect whether or not the
service is running at deploy time, and therefore whether or not to
enable the module.

Change-Id: If0e513e04d3dc567cedd16b440dc2771fddbbb5d

[{'created': '2020-02-19 14:48:49.000000000', 'message': "Ignore pyudev errors about device number

Pyudev is used to return extra data about a device
using the udev interface.

Sometimes that lookup doesn't quite work, like on
md devices after restarting them. As such, we will
now tollerate the failure and continue the process
as before.

Change-Id: Ibbc1759fe2cd3d7d09019b4e80d3c61d54c844dd

"}]
commit_message:
Ignore pyudev errors about device number

Pyudev is used to return extra data about a device
using the udev interface.

Sometimes that lookup doesn't quite work, like on
md devices after restarting them. As such, we will
now tollerate the failure and continue the process
as before.

Change-Id: Ibbc1759fe2cd3d7d09019b4e80d3c61d54c844dd
Story: 2007281
Task: 38726
(cherry picked from commit c1da514645be26a27177f88dad5dba3c76513909)

commit_message:
pre-install: use path and drop dest

We have a few checks that depend on the value of path and
dest is an alias of path anyways so we should just always
use path instead.

Change-Id: I38ed2b120ece1268ccfe519c94bda038571a99b7
(cherry picked from commit bbbbd94101cd3d34e64f4b9b7a4dd88c152cac2f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-18 22:34:32.000000000', 'message': 'podman/systemd: fix task indentation for timer

The timer task needs to be skipped if there is no healthcheck in the
configuration, so move it to the block reserved for healhtcheck tasks so
it gets ignored when a container has no healthecheck.

Change-Id: Ie1a4c5af7c2e8ff3e6ff0b85f264239a8e30e913
'}]
commit_message:
podman/systemd: fix task indentation for timer

The timer task needs to be skipped if there is no healthcheck in the
configuration, so move it to the block reserved for healhtcheck tasks so
it gets ignored when a container has no healthecheck.

Change-Id: Ie1a4c5af7c2e8ff3e6ff0b85f264239a8e30e913

subject: Add adjutant deliverables
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-07 13:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-07 15:27:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM seems right settled.

Adjutant'projects already have some (old) existing releases [1][2][3]... but I don't think it's an issue in an ussuri context and in this context.

Else team is ok [4]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/adjutant/releases
[2] https://github.com/openstack/python-adjutantclient/releases
[3] https://github.com/openstack/adjutant-ui/releases
[4] https://github.com/openstack/governance/blob/master/reference/projects.yaml#L15,L23"}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2020-02-11 01:44:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hey! I'd ideally like to move Adjutant to intermediary releases with cycle, because with the limited number of devs working on it, we're unlikely to meet consistent RC points."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-11 09:28:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

I remove -2 to highlight the Adrian's comment"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-11 13:04:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Hey! I'd ideally like to move Adjutant to intermediary releases
 > with cycle, because with the limited number of devs working on it,
 > we're unlikely to meet consistent RC points.

Thanks Adrian. Is the team ready to do an intermediary release? For cycle-with-intermediary, we want to have at least one release by milestone 2 (this Thursday) to be included in the overall coordinated release. It can just be a 0.1.0. Just so we can make sure the release machinery is good and things are on track for a final release near the end of the cycle."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2020-02-13 02:10:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > Hey! I'd ideally like to move Adjutant to intermediary releases
 > > with cycle, because with the limited number of devs working on
 > it,
 > > we're unlikely to meet consistent RC points.
 > 
 > Thanks Adrian. Is the team ready to do an intermediary release? For
 > cycle-with-intermediary, we want to have at least one release by
 > milestone 2 (this Thursday) to be included in the overall
 > coordinated release. It can just be a 0.1.0. Just so we can make
 > sure the release machinery is good and things are on track for a
 > final release near the end of the cycle.

I have just one patch I feel I really need to merge before any release, but once that is done I can do one.

Just doing some additional testing on:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/706723/

And when that is merged I'd love to do a release of Adjutant itself, and Adjutant-UI not too long after."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2020-02-19 03:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2020-02-19 03:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-19 11:32:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Adrian isn't seen as the PTL [1] I suppose it's due to the email address   used by Adrian [2] which differ from address used with LP/gerrit.

[1] https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_260/706501/2/check/releases-tox-list-changes/2608b78/job-output.txt
[2] https://github.com/openstack/governance/blob/master/reference/projects.yaml#L1,L5"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-02-19 11:44:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

PTL approval will be fixed by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708623/ (cf. my previous comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-19 17:22:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks Adrian. Please try to get an actual release proposed for these as soon as possible.

https://releases.openstack.org/ussuri/schedule.html#u-mf'}]

[{'created': '2020-02-01 08:13:53.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] Set of improvements to avoid timeouts

PLEASE, DO NOT MERGE.
THIS PATCH IS JUST FOR TESTING

List of changes:
- List pids in namespace
- Yield execution in OVS agent only at the end of the loop
- Remove sleep command when retrieving OVS dp (MERGED)

Change-Id: I1231ffc827892dfc10167ae66a0b2634be3c351b
'}]
commit_message:
[DNM] Set of improvements to avoid timeouts

PLEASE, DO NOT MERGE.
THIS PATCH IS JUST FOR TESTING

List of changes:
- List pids in namespace
- Yield execution in OVS agent only at the end of the loop
- Remove sleep command when retrieving OVS dp (MERGED)

Change-Id: I1231ffc827892dfc10167ae66a0b2634be3c351b

use Python 2, like CentOS 7, and compatibility when using Python
3.6 starting from 3.6.9, like in Ubuntu Bionic.

commit_message:
Upgrade pip if it's too old

We upgrade pip only if the version is too old to not support the
-c option.

Change-Id: I6e633debb2bf97f397a4b3d252c25e4a41992a8d

I really don't agree with Jeremy's feedback on the other patch that led to this. If CONTRIBUTING.rst contains anything more complicated than "Don't use GitHub; here are the contributor docs" then we will have a plague of people trying to use GitHub, because people don't read.

> more generally when someone clones the repo and looks at the top-level files like the readme and license, they also have a file detailing how to contribute changes back to the maintainers without having to go digging several levels deep into the source tree for Sphinx-built docs.

I agree; nobody thinks that you should have to go digging through the source.

But a link to docs.o.o should be fine IMHO.

Not gonna -1 because it must be hard enough refereeing this argument already :('}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2020-02-19 15:36:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I am ok with having all info in CONTRIBUTING.rst but we can highlight the first two line in bold so that people at least read it when open this file. rest all detailed info go into next para and so

----------------
OPENSTACK USES GERRIT FOR CODE REVIEW.

ANY PULL REQUESTS SUBMITTED THROUGH GITHUB WILL BE IGNORED.

commit_message:
Fix Contributing template location

There were several discussions[1][2] on includes and
where the template should actually be living for the U
community goal about contributor docs.

Having the information in CONTRIBUTING.rst so that it
appears on github and using an include in
doc/source/contributor/contributing.rst to pull that text
in via Sphinx is a cleaner way of keeping all the info
together.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/696001
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707735/

Change-Id: I2bcda1e0f14dac7843869666df4250604b64c265

anymore.

commit_message:
PowerMax Docs -  corrections and improvements

1.  Corrections to PowerMaxOS versions
2.  Clarifying licensing information
3.  Clarifying upgrade scenarios
4.  Formatting
5.  Failover/failback clarification
6.  Array OS support

Change-Id: I9a7d4bb0810bf47f93eb0f82bfc0e99e7a939af5
(cherry picked from commit 5ccf4856c70742c5ad1f9a3986499c28ae4a5be7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-12 23:22:30.000000000', 'message': "Tell reno to ignore the kilo branch

When reno 3.x runs under setuptools, it scans all of the branches it can
find, including any that look like they're closed and have an -eol tag.
The old kilo branch in this repository has a jumbled history that
somehow makes it look like it should include tags that it doesn't. We
know that there are no release notes in that branch, because reno wasn't
adopted while it was open. The releasenotes/source/index.rst links to
separate release notes in the wiki.

This patch tells reno to ignore that branch so that it doesn't throw an
exception when it gets confused about the old tag.

Change-Id: Idd56c3f37d5786daae7181c36d38d267cbf1885c
Co-Authored-By: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 94b228464dd0c1594c974d333cd31519a48d3761)
"}]
commit_message:
Tell reno to ignore the kilo branch

When reno 3.x runs under setuptools, it scans all of the branches it can
find, including any that look like they're closed and have an -eol tag.
The old kilo branch in this repository has a jumbled history that
somehow makes it look like it should include tags that it doesn't. We
know that there are no release notes in that branch, because reno wasn't
adopted while it was open. The releasenotes/source/index.rst links to
separate release notes in the wiki.

This patch tells reno to ignore that branch so that it doesn't throw an
exception when it gets confused about the old tag.

Change-Id: Idd56c3f37d5786daae7181c36d38d267cbf1885c
Co-Authored-By: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 94b228464dd0c1594c974d333cd31519a48d3761)

commit_message:
Add Adrian's review address to adjutant liaisons

Adrian Turjak is using a different address for reviews than
the one defined in governance. Add the review address to
the adjutant release liaisons so that check-ptl-approval
works as intended.

Change-Id: I26ac918f66146c7b818e646ce54b2aea84a302ac

Add base docker-build job

This job checks workflow that we are using at autobuilds at dockerhub.

Change-Id: Ic4e0eaa726787cc3ebe58ca874845362839701ae

python 2.7 support.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html

Change-Id: Ib3bd70ba8f2e8386643c536ac8194fa99b54b842
'}]
commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

designate-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ib3bd70ba8f2e8386643c536ac8194fa99b54b842

commit_message:
Move tripleo-operator-ansible to indepdendent

We currently don't plan to release this with branches tied to the
openstack releases so independent is likely a better fit for this.

Change-Id: Ia42a869aa8b3772c82ccd178b06846c4eea134f9

commit_message:
Add ceph_ansible_repo variable on ceph-base

In order to properly evaluate the ceph-ansible
repo using validations, this change adds the
"ceph_ansible_repo" variable to point to the
correct default tripleo ceph repo.

Change-Id: Ib398bbb5765fbe87f8e37d7a58b356f7d4670c87
Related-Bug: 1857460

commit_message:
Add missed 'Server ID' output in attachment-list

'server_id' is not Attachment attribute, should be
set by 'instance' attribute.

v3/attachments respond body:

{"attachments":
   [{"status": "attached",
     "instance": INSTANCE_UUID,
     "id": ATTACHMENT_UUID,
     "volume_id": VOLUME_UUID,
    },
    ...
    ]
}

Closes-Bug: #1860393
Change-Id: Ica5d278cb7455befe1db4be0ab65114fd606ea0a
(cherry picked from commit 03f228c11e0d88dcc396b30b7544b5cfde894750)
(cherry picked from commit 511224425804621550bf30403f7768eebe6f34ca)
(cherry picked from commit 14547dfb1b9aced82d5d333ab329870461034565)

LUKS password quality checking is not useful
since we only use long hex strings for passwords.

Not skipping this means that we have to install
cracklib-dicts for cryptsetup to work, which is
unnecessary weight.

Closes-Bug: #1861120

Change-Id: Idc281be7cf88eeeeefe260877a1fc275d94f2bed

'}]
commit_message:
Skip cryptsetup password quality checking

LUKS password quality checking is not useful
since we only use long hex strings for passwords.

Not skipping this means that we have to install
cracklib-dicts for cryptsetup to work, which is
unnecessary weight.

Closes-Bug: #1861120

Change-Id: Idc281be7cf88eeeeefe260877a1fc275d94f2bed
(cherry picked from commit afb7beb7ce98824d5fb789ad8e7577cebae4e41c)
